_header: He that in this book beginneth to read
Note: For a similar but shorter poem cf. 2121.
Bibliographic Ghosts: New Haven, Yale University, Beinecke Library Osborn fa.16
_description: Patris Sapientiae, an alchemical poem — in quatrains (aabb)

BodAsh1445.First Lines:
Thou that this boke beginneth to readekeepe well thy Counsell the
                    better to speede…
BodAsh1445.Last Lines:
…And if thou than not fynde in this booke nether sone nor
                    moneThen goe and seeke further as other fooles haue done

BodAsh1490.First Lines:
He that in this bocke beginneth to readKepe well thine owne
                    Councelle, the bettar shalt thou spead…
BodAsh1490.Last Lines:
…And if your dannot find bt this bock neither sonn nor monThen
                    goe farder and seke thee forth as other fooles have don
BodAsh1490.Note:
120 stanzas; at the end: ‘Explicit Liber patris sapientiae
                    / 1599 Rescriptum per Simonem Forman’.

LincInnH90.First Lines:
Ye þat in this booke beginneth to readeKeep well thine owne
                    Counsell þe better shall thou spede…
LincInnH90.Last Lines:
…Gum & galls but also eggs shellsHony wax Lun Oyles or
                    Eallyelse

BosHistSoc.First Lines:
He that in thys booke begynneth to redeKepe well thy awne counsell
                    the better shall thou spede…
BosHistSoc.Last Lines:
…Also therof thou must haue manye symples to shewOr elles they
                    wyll shrowdlie thynke and say few
